(Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: Liberal Democrats)

Third year Philosophy students are expressing their concerns over issues of grading within the 70-80 Grade Boundary. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: underthesun)

A total of PS630,000 is allocated to the University as part of an investment in 31 universities (Thumbnail credit Credit: University of York)

In Pictures: Remembrance Day parade

Photos from yesterday's Remembrance Day Parade through the centre of York

No option but two semester year for York

The University has signalled that a move towards the controversial semester system is not a question of if, but when (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: aldisley)

Extra VC consultation scheduled

An extra Vice-Chancellor consultation meeting has been arranged for Thursday week six (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: chicgeek)

Community Chair quits Union "clique"

"It's a feeling I have formed by talking to others and it's something I don't want to be seen to be complicit in." (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Martin Spurr)

Unistats reflect poor student satisfaction

"After studying abroad for my second-year, I found York just couldn't offer me the same variety of resources that I'd had access to whilst at a US institution." (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Tom Witherow)

In Pictures: Tea Dance

By James Bithell

With cake, tea and 50s style dress in abundance, last Saturday's Tea Dance, the culmination of last week's Volunteering Week, was a great success in Derwent's Hendrix Hall (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Agatha Torrance)

Disruption at new York Sport Village

With the opening of any new building you anticipate some teething problems and this was the case last weekend

YUSU RAG raised over PS80,000 last year

RAG has announced that students raised approximately PS87,129 last year, PS84000 of which was from charity events held during the academic year 2011/2012 (Thumbnail credit Photocredit: YUSURAG)

PhD's 'Movefellas' Movember

Two PHD students and three alumni members of the University of York, have formed a team to raise money on behalf of Movember, for Prostate Cancer UK and the Institute of Cancer Research (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Theo Georgiou)

Struggle for student housing applications

The council are making it harder for private landlords to get planning permission to legally permit students to live in their houses. The moves have been made, amongst other reasons, in response to an increase in complaints against a number of students from residents living in areas such as Tang Hall, Badger Hill and Fulford (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Alan Rostron)

Health Centre suffers appointment backlog

The University's Health Centre has been inundated with student appointments since the beginning of the year, leading to a backlog with waiting times of over two weeks

Semester changes to fundamentally reshape student activities

The move to two 15-week semesters, instead of the current three 10-week terms, would have a significant impact upon the way both sports clubs and societies operate (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

"I think everybody wants to see and touch the vice-chancellor", says Chair of Council

Nouse speaks to Sir Christopher O'Donnell, Chair of the University Council and the man leading the recruitment process for the next vice-chancellor (Thumbnail credit Brian Cantor is stepping down in December 2013 Photo credit: Georgi Mabee)

Council support student Living Wage campaign

York councillors are urging the University to implement the Living Wage

Kuda license causes concerns

Students have raised concerns over the official YUSU Tuesday student night at Kuda (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: newcastleVip)

YUSU supports National Student Demo

Planning is underway for the upcoming '#Demo2012: Educate, Employ, Empower' (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: YUSU)

The Students who never Left

By James Bithell

Many a student may fantasize about student life with no end, but hidden in the fabric of University and Union administration are those who might just be making this a reality, as Tom Witherow finds out (Thumbnail credit Cartoon Credit: Alice Brooksbank)

The new YUSU student centre: from start to finish

Follow Nouse as we chart the progress of the much-anticipated Student Centre, to its completion in July of this year.

Illegal student housing under investigation

Up to 70 student houses across York are currently being investigated by the City of York Council for not having legal planning permission (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: rachel sian)

Halifax footballers banned from league

Second and third years of the Halifax firsts football team have being banned from competing this term after causing substantial damage on their 'World tour' of campus social (Thumbnail credit Photocredit: Agatha Torrance)

Proposed degree overhaul to impact first year students

By James Bithell

The University is considering introducing a reports scheme that could supplant the traditional honours grading system (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: aldisley)

New Langwith accepts first students

By James Bithell

Hundreds of students have moved into new Langwith accommodation on Heslington East, as the college makes the move to the new campus (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Laura Hughes)

YUSU's relationship with Salvation sours

Club Salvation decided to run their F**K ME! York University Night on Monday, despite concerns raised to the local nightclub by the University of York Students' Union (YUSU) (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andorpro)
